page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY
page.content:
The village is like a history book.It dates back to the time when the first Domesday book was written in 1086. {Thornton Watlass}was then two villages, Thornton and Watlass.The village Thornton got its name because of the thorn trees and Watlass because there was no water in the village. Watlass means 'waterless'.The nearest water supply was just out side the present village.
The present village is situated around a village green.In the centre is a large tree called the stock tree, named after the stocks which used to be on the green.The cricket pitch is there.The village hall faces the stock tree.It is used for parties and clubs.Most of the older houses facing the green are stone.
